description:
Please don't act on this ticket.
Used for internal tests only.

Please create the final model for the Transformer, Bonecrusher. He is an A-Class transformer, and so represents some of the most popular and highest-quality troops we have in the game. We would allow up to 6 days work on a character of this quality - we would also like to make sure the model is optimal in terms of poly count, but looks fantastic.

The blockout for this Transformer, as well as the working files, can be found here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/30rZDeJUtY

The final concept is attached.

Please create the final model for the Transformer, Bonecrusher. He is a B-Class transformer, so ideally we should spend no more than 4 days working on him.

The blockout for this Transformer, as well as the working files, can be found here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/T6tb816Tbj

The final concept is attached.

description:
Please follow the Transformation brief sent over with the previous character animation tickets.

To complete the transformation will require modifications to the biped rig, the character should be able to fit properly into it’s "alt form" without requiring a noticeable model swap. Please also ensure there are no keys between frames. Please ensure you switch on the Transformers character set (bottom right).

The character that we want to Transform is called Air Raid. The working folder is here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/qLTt7ysJrf

Internally, we have timeboxed this character as a "Class B". We would not want a Class B character to take more than 5 days (incl rigging & transformation), so if there are any concerns on that timeline, please let me know and we will try to provide more assistance.

comments.body:
Hi Natalie,

We have started to do rigging of Powerglide, and we have a question on the same.

We are not able to hide one the flight's part in sided the bot because it is a huge part of flight. Should we switch off the visibility of the part or break the part as 3 to 4 junks ? 
We have attached two images to show you the part is not fitting in side the bot.

Thanks & Regards,
Anoop R K

Hi Anoop,

This is an issue with the modelling, it looks like the 3D artist hasn't started from the vehicle and created the bot from the pieces during the blockout and modelling stages. Our concept artists look at the troop from a purely aesthetic standpoint, which is why we ask the 3D artist to be careful and ensure they create the vehicle first.

Please can you ask Ravi to have the artist adjust the model to include this segment of the vehicle so that it can be correctly transformed?

We would recommend using this video as reference in addition to our moodboards. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6C4AXm__C2k

Cheers,
Natalie

comments.body:
Hi Natalie,

How are you? 

This is Sathish Ragav from the 2D team. We just wanted to let you know that we have started the work for these banners and we will be uploading them tomorrow.

Thanks

Hi Sathish,

I'm well, thank you. It's a pleasure to meet you.

We're looking forward to seeing the banners tomorrow.

Cheers,
Natalie

Hi Natalie,

It is my pleasure to work with you too :)

Here is our take on the banners and we made 2 versions for banner B. Please do let us know your overall feedback.

Thank you

Hi Sathish,

We will take a look at these and give our feedback tomorrow. Apologies that we aren't able to review them faster.

Cheers,
Natalie

Hi Sathish,

Please find our feedback from Jay,

GraphicDesign_Banner_A
I love the FX treatment on the ironhide render, makes him feel more comic book like
I like the idea of having a big, bold character on one side and the copy on the other side. The message is clear and concise. 
Additional strokes should not be added to the logo* or to the character - I would of painted a rim light on the character to bring him off of the background
We should only be using brand colours (red, purple, grey) - no turquoise/teal 
Not sure about the typography treatment, it feels very tight/cluttered in the bottom right corner
*we have a new logo now which is much more readable on all kinds of backgrounds. See below for reference.


GraphicDesign_Banner_B1
Lovely rim lit characters - this technique should of been applied to Banner A
Strong concept/composition, it really feels like the characters are there in a war environment
I think the blue light flares on Optimus's eyes should be horizontal and not vertical
The red grid with the text on top feels a bit weak and is not tall enough. Grids and gradients should be consistent across all ads. The grid height was nicer on Banner A
The negative space on the left hand side could of been filled more - feels very empty between the app store button and the red grid
Lighting - a bit too many colours on Optimus. The red, blue, yellow and green is a bit heavy

GraphicDesign_Banner_B2
Lovely rim lit characters - this technique should of been applied to Banner A
Strong concept/composition, it really feels like the characters are there in a war environment
I think the blue light flares on Optimus's eyes should be horizontal and not vertical
No need for the grid, the advert is strong enough as it is. the faint grid isn't adding anything
Lighting - a bit too many colours on Optimus. The red, blue, yellow and green is a bit heavy 
Very impressed all in all

Cheers,
Natalie

Hi Natalie,

We have made the modifications as per your comment and we are uploading them for your review. Please let us know your thoughts on the same.

GraphicDesign_Banner_A_01 : We used blue rim light because we took light source of the earth in the background.

Thank you

Hi Sathish,

We just have one final request, could we please have the Apple Store badge replaced with the Google Play store badge? Once that's done, can you please make the PSDs available to us and please consider the assets approved with our compliments.

I'm looking forward to discussing how we can work together to do many more of these in future!

Cheers,
Natalie

comments.body:
Hi Natalie,

Submission for the day is Charge Attack animation for your review.


Thanks & Regards,
Anoop R K

Hey Anoop,

Please consider this asset signed off and approved. Neil's feedback below:

This is a great first iteration. I've adjusted the animation in a couple of places;

I've moved the character forward to emphasize the hit.
I've delayed the back legs by a few frames to give the character more weight by driving off these feet.
I've removed the wobble/jiggle at the end of the animation. The 'jiggle' is best used to accent and emphasize action and works well for the fist strike. I don't think it is necessary for when he returns to his position.
See below for comparisons; Updated version is blue, the original is red.

Cheers,
Natalie
I wasn't able to attach the Maya file. Please find it here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/pkWITAHD6B

description:
This is a character, he should be modelled in a similar method to the buildings with some obvious differences. The Transformers have a bot form and an alt form (usually some kind of vehicle). We need to create the robot and vehicle models at the same time to make sure they are interchangeable. The final transformation is done with a model swap at the last frame of the animation.

The character has a lowpoly form and texture already, which you can find here: 
https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/IZBt6LoivC

The lowpoly texture should be discarded when the final texture is made, this is just for reference. The blockout itself should be built on to create the final model, the concept should not require too many changes to the blockout (as it is a paintover).

Please follow the final concept, attached, for details on panelling, refining the model, etc.

comments.body:
Hi Natalie,

Submission for the day is Idle animation for your review.

Thanks & Regards,
Anoop

Hey Anoop,

Please see our feedback:

This is a good start. Areas to address;
The foot steps; frames 1-10, frames 68-77, frames 115-121, frames 124-129. When the character takes each step the feet are moving too quickly and lifting too high. This is stopping the character from feeling heavy. The footsteps need to be slowed and kept lower.

frames 68-77. When the character takes his step. Please make sure the character is moving forward before he lifts his right foot. At the moment he is lifting his leg and moving backwards before going forwards which looks very unbalanced, see picture attached of frame 75;

The right leg should be driving the character forward before it is lifted.

Cheers,
Natalie

We have addressed the above mentioned corrections and uploading the file for your review.

description:
When this character falls in battle, he needs to animate into an injured position and hold that position while he gets "beamed out". In terms of the game's story, this character is not dying, but just becoming temporarily inactive (think Pokemon fainting).

This character's main form resembles a dinosaur, please use this form for the animation. (Ignore the robotic alt form)

Animation should be between 30-100 frames. Please ensure there are no keys between frames.

Character's working folder is here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/RAMEJ4dwaj

This link is temporary (30 days), please let me know if access runs out and you need it again.

Just one piece of feedback for the battle transform:

The battle transform back to the robot (frames 267-296) The character lands with his hands on the ground like the hero transform then stands up. description:
Please follow the Transformation brief sent over with the previous character animation tickets.

To complete the transformation will require modifications to the biped rig, the character should be able to fit properly into it’s "alt form" without requiring a noticeable model swap. Please also ensure there are no keys between frames. Please ensure you switch on the Transformers character set (bottom right).

The character that we want to Transform is called Swindle. 
The maya file containing the character and rig is here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/TjR6uhNXhS
You can find the texture here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/yJDSOf8XKU
The vehicle form can be found here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/7BPj6KH81k

These links are temporary, so please just let me know if they expire and you need access again. Also please let me know if there are any questions.

Internally, we have timeboxed these characters as a "Class B". We would not want a Class B character to take more than 5 days (incl rigging & transformation), so if there are any concerns on that timeline, please let me know and we will try to provide more assistance.

description:
This is a character, he should be modelled in a similar method to the buildings with some obvious differences. The Transformers have a bot form and an alt form (usually some kind of vehicle). We need to create the robot and vehicle models at the same time to make sure they are interchangeable. The final transformation is done with a model swap at the last frame of the animation.

The character has a lowpoly form and texture already, which you can find here: 
https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/FPWkS8QFVW

The lowpoly texture should be discarded when the final texture is made, this is just for reference. The blockout itself should be built on to create the final model, the concept should not require too many changes to the blockout (as it is a paintover).

Please follow the final concept, attached, for details on panelling, refining the model, etc.

We have some queries.
- Do you want us to do the skinning and animation or only animation ?

- Could you please provide any image or character model sheet where we can understand how the character is going to be transformed from vehicle to robot which will be helpful for the rigging.

Thanks,

Hi Anoop,

Just the animation please. The texture is available here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/jtCyqUahCC (If you need it and aren't able to get it to work, please let me know).

I had sent the wrong link, my apologies. This is the bot form: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/QPzPl7jIcW
(I will update the description with this link)

We're not able to provide the explanation for how the character transforms, that's down to the animator. Please reference the brief for tips on how to create this animation in our style.
If you're unable to access the document, please give me the email address you would like me to send it to and I will grant you access.

Thank you,
Natalie

Hi Natalie,

We have received the new rigs and description(which is similar to old one).

We have checked skydive and Silverbolt rigs and found that some controls and attributes are missing compared to starscream rig which you have sent as reference,
 I have attached an image to show the missing controllers which are required for the transformation animation.

Hi Natalie,

Please update the  description too, and let us know once you updated from your side.

Thanks,
Ravi

Hi Anoop,

As it mentions in the brief, you will have to make additions to the rig in order to create the transformation animations. However, the animations will all use this rig, so please make sure you're adding joints for the transform, but not changing the base rig. 

Please do let me know if you're not able to access the brief? Everything should be explained there.

Thanks,
Natalie

Hi Ravi,

I have updated the description to include the correct link. What information do you need in the description?

Cheers,
Natalie

I just want to be clear, this task includes both rigging and animation of this character. The model and texture should not need any work at all.

All information should be in the brief, which is linked in the description, but is also here: https://docs.google.com/a/spaceapegames.com/document/d/1j7WJktaK15-Ipk30GefYgo6D4w2CigZVML43g1JFCMQ/edit?usp=sharing

If you cannot access this document, please tell me the email address who needs access. If there is anything in this document which is not clear, please let me know specifically what is wrong?

description:
Please find our Transformation brief here (You will need to request permissions to view this document.): https://docs.google.com/a/spaceapegames.com/document/d/1j7WJktaK15-Ipk30GefYgo6D4w2CigZVML43g1JFCMQ/edit?usp=sharing

The files mentioned in the brief are here:
https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/fl/e4xUwSadgC

As you can see, to complete the transformation will require modifications to the biped rig, the character should be able to fit properly into it's "alt form" without requiring a noticeable model swap.

The character that we want to Transform is called Skydive. The maya file containing the character and rig is here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/QPzPl7jIcW
You can find the texture here: https://spaceapegames.egnyte.com/dl/jtCyqUahCC


These links are temporary, so please just let me know if they expire and you need access again. Also please let me know if there are any questions.

Internally, we have timeboxed these characters as a "Class B", whereas the Starscream animation is a "Class A". We would not want a Class B character to take more than 5 days (incl rigging & transformation), so if there are any concerns on that timeline, please let me know and we will try to provide more assistance.

He had a look at the texture PSD and was surprised to find that there are sections of our pipeline document that have been completely ignored and the template was not used when selecting colours. A lot of work was put into that pipeline document and the template to ensure we are not wasting time on this project.

Please ensure that the pipeline document is followed and the template is used when creating all assets. While it's not immediately visible and your original texture appears to match the concept, it is vital that your team uses the template colours because otherwise the asset will look different to our current in-game assets. We have adjusted Level 6 internally to bring it in line with the documentation, but please ensure that if there are questions or concerns about the pipeline document that you let me know so that we can make the document clearer.

Natalie
